instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has image no backlight
threads.message:
I can see image on original screen and test screen but no backlight. <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT</SIGNAL> is present. No signs of liquid damage or corrosion.

Below are the <TRANSISTOR>Q8400</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> voltages.

<TRANSISTOR>Q8400</TRANSISTOR>:
pin 3: 12.6V
pin 4: 13.1V
pin 1,2,5,6: <2V

<CHIP>U8400</CHIP>:
pin 1,2: 0.3V
pin 4: 0.0V
pin 5: 5.1V
pin 9,10: 13.1V
pin 11: 12.4V
pin 12: 0.0V
pin 15,16: 4.5V
pin 17: 3.3V
pin 18: 5.1V
pin 19: 0.2V
pin 21: 0.0V

Could this be a T2 issue needing revive/restore? Seems nowadays all roads lead to T2

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has image no backlight
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R8450</RESISTOR>-53 and their traces.
Also check voltage and diode mode on SCL/SDA lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has image no backlight
threads.message: diode of pin 1 for <RESISTOR>R8451</RESISTOR>/0 are both .515 voltage is 4.5V at both as well. Traces all good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has image no backlight
threads.message:
Be sure <DIODE>D8410</DIODE> is not shorted A-K.
Check diode mode to ground on both sides.

You may need to change <CHIP>U8400</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Has image no backlight
threads.message:
Man, I don't know how but I thought I had checked <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> for short already. Sorry for wasting your time! There was a short on on <CAPACITOR>C8462</CAPACITOR>. Guess I'm just over here making things harder than they should be. 
Thanks for helping me pull my head out of my ass haaha
